an4.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Vajjians at the village of Bhaṇḍa.
an4.1:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an4.1:5.1: “Mendicants, not understanding and not penetrating four things, both you and I have wandered and transmigrated for such a very long time.
an4.1:5.7: This noble ethics, samādhi, wisdom, and freedom have been understood and penetrated. Craving to be reborn has been cut off; the attachment to being reborn is ended; now there are no more future lives.
an4.1:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
an4.1:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
an4.1:8.1: And so the Buddha, having insight,
an4.1:8.2: explained this Dharma to the mendicants.
an4.1:8.3: The teacher made an end of suffering,
